heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 21 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.2°C) and outside temperature (up 2.3°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 593 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 45.5°C), feels like temperature (up 49.7°C), outside temperature (up 48.5°C), and cloud levels (up 218 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 592.9m lower than yesterday, 218.2m lower than the past week, 118.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1011m minimum and 4080m maximum, with an average of 1599.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1817.7m and 1718.0m.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and little or no wind. Possible light showers, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and very bright daylight. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.
